Advisory Council

Meet our Advisory Council

At the Indian School of Hospitality, we sincerely value the power of ideas. Our advisory council is in place to ensure our continued strive towards growth and innovation. Comprised of thought leaders and heads of various industries spanning across hospitality, education, and business, our advisory board ensures constant development towards bettering our educational approach and philosophy and understanding of industry requirements.

Frits van Paasschen, Former CEO of Starwood Hotels & Resorts and Author of Amazon Bestseller ‘The Disruptors’ Feast’

Frits van Paasschen is the former CEO of Starwood Hotels and Coors Brewing Company. Prior to being CEO, he was President of Nike Europe, Middle East and Africa and Vice President of Finance at Disney.

He began his career as a consultant at the Boston Consulting Group and McKinsey. Mr van Paasschen has served on the corporate boards of Oakley, Jones Apparel, and Barclays. He was Chairman of the European-American Industrial Council and a board member of both the US-China and US-India Business Councils, and is currently a non-executive director at Royal DSM and Williams-Sonoma. Mr van Paasschen was the Dean's Distinguished Lecturer at the Cornell School of Hotel Administration and a Conti Professor at the Penn State School of Hospitality Management. As an MBA student, he lectured in economics as a Teaching Fellow at Harvard College. Mr. van Paasschen is an avid traveller and has had numerous visits to India across the span of three decades.

Expand Biography

Yateendra Sinh, Chief Executive Officer Lausanne Hospitality Consulting

The head of Lausanne Hospitality Consulting SA (LHC), Yateendra is at the forefront of LHC’s business strategies and client portfolio management.

He is an alumnus of The Oberoi School of Hotel Management (now OCLD), India’s foremost institution of higher learning in the hospitality industry. He has held various senior executive roles in hotels, townships, and large IT infrastructure networks.

Yateendra has trained and consulted clients on strategic and operational issues in 50+ countries, and supports the development of innovative solutions within the hospitality industry worldwide.

Expand Biography

Nirupa Shankar, Director, Brigade Hospitality

As a second generation entrepreneur at Brigade, Nirupa oversees the company’s hospitality ventures. During her 8 years in Brigade she has helped launch 3 hotels, signed up more than 12 for the pipeline, of which 8 are already in various stages of construction. of Brigade REAP.

Nirupa also conceptualised and successfully launched the multi-award winning lounge bar HIGH Ultra Lounge in Bangalore, the highest point for food and beverage in South India.

Nirupa recently launched India’s first and only real estate accelerator called Brigade Real Estate Accelerator Program, an initiative to mentor high-tech start-ups in real estate, including hospitality.

She has been identified as one of CNBC’s “Young Turks” and has previously won the:

Entrepreneur of the Year 2017, by Future Woman Leader Summit Young Entrepreneur of the Year 2016 by Construction Week Restaurant Owner of the Year – India 2016 at the Hospitality Leaders’ Industry Choice Awards Rising Star Award 2015 - South Asia by the International Society of Hospitality Consultants

Nirupa is passionate about reading, travelling and writing. Her articles are regularly published in the news and trade journals. She loves sports and recently completed her first triathlon. She is trained as a Six sigma Black Belt.

Expand Biography

Ingo Schweder, Founder & CEO, GOCO Hospitality

Founder & CEO of GOCO Hospitality, and Managing Director of Horwath HTL Health and Wellness, Ingo Schweder brings more than 30 years of experience from the fields of spa and hospitality, and has been involved in the design, development and worldwide operation of numerous iconic hotels and wellness destinations.

Under his guidance, Ananda in the Himalayas, the globally recognised destination spa, was established Ingo has been a board member of Mandarin Oriental and earlier Corporate Director of Operations for Oberoi Hotels & Resorts.

His vision for GOCO Hospitality is to grow the company in the vastly expanding wellness real estate and hospitality segment. The company’s reputation after only five years now speaks for itself. GOCO Hospitality has become the go-to wellness company for hospitality giants like Bulgari, Ritz-Carlton, Viceroy Hotels & Resorts, Wynn Resorts, MGM, Emaar Hospitality and Four Seasons. In addition, GOCO Hospitality recently purchased the 85-acre Glen Ivy Hot Springs in Southern California and is expanding it with additional wellness real estate anchored by a 125-room GOCO wellness retreat.

Expand Biography

Neeraj Govil, Area Vice President - South Asia Marriott International

With over twenty years of hospitality experience spanning across multiple countries and various Marriott International brands, Neeraj Govil is responsible for strategic leadership, establishing brand positioning and expanding effective market share of the Marriott International brand portfolio in South Asia.

Kapil Chopra, President, The Oberoi Group

An alumni of The Oberoi Centre for Learning and Development (OCLD), Mr. Chopra's experience as a hotelier spans over nineteen years.

Most recently, Mr. Chopra was the Executive Vice President of the Group and was instrumental in opening two flagship properties - The Oberoi and Trident in Gurgaon. Mr. Chopra was also voted "Hotelier of the Year" by Hindustan Times in 2012. The Oberoi Group was voted 'World's Leading Luxury Hotel Brand' by the World Travel Awards in 2012. Furthermore, under Mr. Chopra's leadership, The Oberoi, Gurgaon was voted 'World's Leading Luxury Hotel' by the World Travel Awards for the second consecutive year in 2012. The Oberoi, Gurgaon was also awarded 'Best Hotel for Business in India' by Condé Nast Traveller, India, Readers' Travel Awards 2012.

Expand Biography

Jean-Michel Cassé Chief Operating Officer, India and South Asia, AccorHotels

Jean-Michel Cassé is the Chief Operating Officer [COO] - India and South Asia for AccorHotels.

He is responsible for leading teams in the region to ensure AccorHotels’ continued growth momentum in India and South Asia led by the Group’s fervent focus on guests first and foremost while performing strongly for its owners and investors. Under his leadership AccorHotels has a fast growing network of hotels in India spanning the luxury to economy segments across ten brands.

A seasoned hotelier, Jean-Michel has over three decades of industry experience and a deep understanding of varied cultures, having worked across multiple international markets in Europe, Asia, Middle East and Africa.

Widely recognised for his outstanding skills, expertise and contribution, Jean-Michel Cassé was awarded a Gold Bernache for Professionalism by the Chairman of AccorHotels in 2004. In 2007, he was conferred with the “Chevalier de l’Ordre National du Merite”, a French honour for distinguished civil and military achievements by the erstwhile French President.

Expand Biography

Rajiv Kaul, President, Leela Palaces, Hotels & Resorts

A seasoned hotelier, Kaul began his hospitality career with The Oberoi Hotels and Resorts in 1978, before finally taking over as Vice-President of Oberoi Hotels Egypt.

Subsequent to this, he was Vice-President of Taj Mumbai Hotels, and General Manager of The Taj Mahal Palace & Tower. Kaul joined Leela as Senior Vice-President in March 2006, taking over operations at the Group across six properties as well as the planning for The Leela Palace, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi and the Leela Palace, Chennai. In 2010, The Leela Hotel Group announced the elevation of Rajiv Kaul as its President, making him responsible for new launches that the Group earmarked in its expansion plans.

Expand Biography

Ajay Bakaya, Managing Director, Sarovar Hotels

Ajay Bakaya is a seasoned hotelier, responsible for overseeing the operations, development and expansion of Sarovar Hotels, which have a portfolio with over seventy-five hotels across fifty destinations in India and Africa.

Ajay joined Sarovar over two decades ago, and has been instrumental in the success story of the company. He led its growth from their first hotel in Mumbai, to today’s enviable portfolio that encompasses Sarovar Premiere, Sarovar Portico, and Hometel brands. A postgraduate from Cornell-Essec, France, Ajay is a graduate from the Oberoi School of Hotel Management. He has a passion for travel and is a keen cyclist. He was awarded “Entrepreneur of the Year” by the Federation of Hotels & Restaurants Association of India and the “Hall of Fame” award by Hotelier India.

Expand Biography

Ragini Chopra, Vice President (Corporate Affairs & Public Relations), Jet Airways

Ragini Chopra was the first lady management trainee to graduate from the Oberoi School of Hotel Management in 1975.

Thereafter, she spent 28 years with Oberoi Hotels and Resorts in various senior capacities in operations, sales and marketing, branding and launch of the groups Luxury Resorts, headed both corporate sales and marketing and corporate communications, culminating in her assignment as Vice President Business Development for the group.

Nationally regarded as a travel & tourism and aviation industry professional, Mrs. Ragini Chopra serves on various industry committees on tourism (India Initiatives) and civil aviation, including the World Travel and Tourism Council (WTTC), CII National Committee Civil Aviation and Tourism, ASSOCHAM’s Expert Committee on Tourism and Civil Aviation, FICCI National Committee on Civil Aviation and Tourism and the Executive Committee of the Pacific Asia Travel Association (PATA). Mrs. Ragini Chopra worked closely with the team that conceptualised and launched ‘Incredible India’ – the global campaign for marketing Indian tourism, and continues to actively promote tourism as a member of ‘Experience India Society’ and WTTC India Initiative.

In her current role as Vice President, Corporate Affairs and Public Relations, Mrs. Chopra is part of the senior management team of Jet Airways, and is involved in the organisation’s quest for image development, reputation management, services improvement and revenue enhancement. She continues to be closely involved with the company’s strategic initiatives.  Her assignments include key government and stake holder relationships furthering the interests of the company with relevant organisations overseeing both corporate communications for the group and handling the Corporate Social Responsibility portfolio of the organisation and the airline’s magazine JetWings.

Expand Biography

Rohit Khosla, Senior Vice President Operations, Taj

Rohit Khosla, a postgraduate in hotel management from The Institute of Hotel Management Mumbai, joined the Taj Group in 1999 as Executive Assistant Manager, Taj Palace Hotel, New Delhi.

During his time with the Group, he has held several positions in India, Yemen, Maldives and Sri Lanka, and has shown unwavering support and dedication to the Taj brand. In this role, Rohit oversees all of the Group’s hotels in Northern and Eastern states of India (Rajasthan, Delhi, J&K, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Uttaranchal, Madhya Pradesh, West Bengal, Assam), as well as the Taj Dubai, Taj Tashi, Bhutan and the Operations of Taj Safaris. He is currently based in New Delhi.

Expand Biography

Bibhor Srivasta, ‎Group Publishing Director, ‎ITP Media Group

Currently working with ITP Media Group, Mumbai as Group Publishing Director, Bibhor Srivastava has 20+ years of accomplished experience in publishing, conferences and exhibitions, marketing and sales management, business development, extensive understanding of online space, PR & Brand management.

ITP Media Group is the largest foreign media house in the Middle East with a portfolio of over 80 titles focusing on business-to-business, consumer, technology and communications markets. The Group’s multi-business model also includes online publishing, corporate publishing, branded and managed events. The ITP Publishing business spans across offices in UK, India, the Middle East, with its headquarters in Dubai, with over 500 employees across these regions. In India, ITP publishes the industry’s leading B2B Titles such as Hotelier India, Architect & Interiors India, Construction Week, Digital Studio, Manufacturing Today, Healthcare Radius & Commercial Design, along with an extensive event portfolio such as knowledge based conferences, seminars, round tables & branded awards.

Bibhor has been responsible for growing the Indian business, driving the move from print to online to events and ensuring each brand has a clear and ambitious strategy to lead in their respective industry, resulting in the overall success and strategy of the Indian branch of the business. He has also represented the brand at various forums and events across India as the Chief Guest, Speaker and member of the Advisory Council. Prior to ITP, Bibhor has been VP Sales and Marketing for 9.9 Media and was instrumental in developing international business and managing key clients. Other brands that he has been associated with are 20:20 media, India Electric market and Indian Express.
